intro: Aeollanthus myrianthus, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, velvety leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to deep red. It thrives in humid, warm climates and is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and clearings. Aeollanthus myrianthus is also valued for its ornamental appeal and has been introduced to other parts of the world as a garden plant.
